Jesus turns to the suffering one, and says, \93Thou dumb and deaf spirit, I charge thee, come out of him,
188
and enter no more into him.\94 There is a cry, an agonized struggle. The demon, in passing, seems about to rend the life from his victim. Then the boy lies motionless, and apparently lifeless. The multitude whisper, \93He is dead.\94 But Jesus takes him by the hand, and lifting him up, presents him, in perfect soundness of mind and body, to his father. Father and son praise the name of their Deliverer.\97DA 428, 429.
